A mobile app that connects homeless individuals with local businesses and organizations that offer job training, job placement, and other resources. The app could also provide information on available shelters, food banks, and other services in the area.
A community garden program that provides fresh produce to homeless individuals and families, as well as job training and education on sustainable agriculture.

A micro-housing development project that creates affordable, permanent housing for homeless individuals and families. The development could also include amenities such as a community kitchen, laundry facilities, and a computer lab.

A partnership between local businesses and homeless service providers to create a "hospitality" program that provides temporary housing and support services to homeless individuals during the winter months.

A social enterprise that creates job opportunities for homeless individuals by training them in sustainable woodworking and furniture making, and then selling the products in a retail store or online.
